summary: Love the culture and pay, but it's messy
pros:
The culture is pretty amazing. Very pragmatic and focused on the essentials, like providing pure customer value.

Large diversity of projects within the company.
cons:
Jack of all trades. Not necessarily a ton of serious investment in each individual business.

Very project driven. On a lot of orgs, quality is low in many ways because focus is always on the next big thing.

Engineers are fungible, but very few specialists which results in sub-par quality.

summary: Will tear down your mental health
pros: Compensation is good, as much as people complain about the stocks, it's really good pay
cons:
5 day return to office
High workload
Demanding managers
Do more with fewer people = late hours
Colocation mandates
The high pay will trap you here

summary: Decent place to work
pros: It has great compensation. Workload depends on org you are joining
cons: It can get hectic very quickly. Poor upper management communication

summary: Good pay, looks good on resume, leadership stupid
pros: They pay well and health benefits are not so bad
cons: Leadership encourages backstabbing, promo based on people not performance, high risk of burnout

summary: Interesting
pros: Opportunity to develop and own your career if you choose to learn and be heard.
cons: Middle management challenges make it hard to conduct the work without constant review

summary: Work life balance is pathetic. Good growth and projects will help you in your learning
pros: Learning and good projects which have a huge customer impact
cons: Work life balance is pathetic. URA and pip culture is toxic. Overall the company is trash

summary: Systemic Toxic Management, Culture, and Politics
pros: Easy to get your foot in the door if you are seeking a FC or DC IC role, even with no prior experience.
cons: Toxic Management, Culture, and Politics. All employees are treated as just a number to anyone above them in their reporting chain. Management is very obsessive with metrics and meeting quotas. Plays the finger pointing name and blame game every time they get upset about something and flames blame downward to whoever is the lowest in the totem pole. No one admits mistakes or accepts accountability. They tend to get petty when you tell them no. DCs are ran with the mindsets of FCs due to the prominent amount of managers that have moved to the DCs from the FCs over the past 3-4 years. Transferring internally is harder than they make it out to be because your managers support is required for you to transfer.

summary: decent place to start
pros: You get opportunities to be Innovative , take risks but may back fire.
cons: It can get quite Competitive and there is a lot of work politics

summary: Stay away
pros: RSUs / Sign on in first years makes it worth it as a quick stop if you can survive PIP culture
cons: Toxicity everywhere. When I first joined things were a lot better, but it's become political and downright evil in many places

summary: Very bad work life balance
pros: Once you are in, you can easily move to different teams with diverse experiences. At least, that was the case 2 years ago.
cons: Work-life balance is really bad. Especially majority of the teams are expanded on different time zones.

summary: Great scope and impact, toxic culture has taken over middle management.
pros: Breadth of opportunities, opportunity for massive scope and impact if you chase after it.
cons: Turf wars are rampant and the management culture has become very toxic.  If you don't play politics you'll get burned and managed out.  SDE community is very top heavy which will lead to layoffs.  Getting to Sr and beyond is a joke with all the DEI nonsense.

summary: I would love to stay longer but the company makes you leave
pros: 1) Pay, 2) People you work is very intelligent, 3) Speed, 4) Facilities, 5) Benefits
cons: Attrition is high it doesn’t matter, leaders don’t care no matter what they just want the people to work really hard to deliver results , that’s the only thing that matters

summary: OK company to work for
pros: Career growth, if you are on the right team with the right manager. Will be able to learn a lot
cons: RTO5, politics, some teams are very toxic. Beware when choosing teams

summary: Gone downhill
pros: None at all. Things were ok pre covid. Now gone downhill.
cons: Five days return to office. No benefits compared to similar other places.

summary: Great for getting your foot in the door in the tech world
pros: The pay is well above industry average and I’m making more than my previous roles at non-tech companies. Whether my pay is high among other tech companies, I’m not sure. The job can be overwhelming but you will learn a lot so it helps to be curious. I’m getting great work experience here.
cons: You will probably be working a lot. Time management is key and you need to learn how to prioritize. Promotions can be tough and require consistent high performance to be considered for a promotion.

summary: Great place for scientists
pros: Innovation, pay are the best in class in seattle. Good work life balance
cons: Lack of impactful work in some teams might cause frustration

summary: A dot in the ocean
pros: Career growth is good if you want to work hard
cons: Pressure the next in line. Poor feedback and quotas to meet.

summary: Okay tech company, can be easily toxic
pros:
Flexible projects
Clear goals and deliverables
ICs are smart
People are nice but it depends on the team a lot
cons:
Huge discrepancy between competency of ICs and managers
Old tech and methods
Not much emphasis on science
Benefits are not as good as other
 big tech
Pip culture

summary: Good starting point for new grad
pros:
1. Big name
2. Good place to learn AWS
3. easy to transfer internally （day1）
cons:
1. No free foods
2. less benefit compare to other tech company
3. bad management

summary: Good place to start your career
pros: Good learning opportunities, great scale. Access to Senior folks. :D
cons: Managers don't change their perception about people even when there are good reasons to do so.

summary: Bad work life balance , toxic management , good career growth
pros: Good career growth. A lot of learning opportunities. Surrounded by talented people
cons: Bad management looking to create their own little personal kingdoms. Work life balance takes a hit frequently in the year. Promotions are dangled infront of developers so that they slave away more

summary: It depends on the team
pros: Stocks, ability to innovate, stable company and great budgets for marketing.
cons: While the company is stable, it’s a fear based environment of layoffs/RIFs, RTO, and over engineered ideas with a ton of bureaucracy.

summary: toxic culture, lots to learn
pros:
lots of smart engineers to work with
decent comp
you will learn a lot
cons:
toxic management
pip quota causes people to constantly fear for their jobs
oncall for a lot of teams is extremely painful
reasonResign: manager change and reorgs, culture overall was causing heavy stress. also RTO5

summary: Great WLB, everything else is average
pros: Good work life balance (team dependent). Somewhat interesting work around AI
cons: Pay for internal promos is a joke even after years at the level.

summary: No WLB
pros:
Free bananas with limited amounts
One of the big names
cons: No WLB, actually there is no L and no B

summary: Trending down
pros: Opportunities to move internally, expand into new roles are easily available, but mobility barriers are also increasing.
cons: Culture feels like it's been trending downward over past 3 years, comp is poor

summary: Great for feeling out different roles
pros: You can change teams every year so you don’t feel bored
cons:
Very frugal in amenities 
5 day RTO plus no free lunch

summary: Politics and great people around
pros:
High bar for professionals
Good compensation 
If you got a good manager you should be fine
cons:
Politics and mess, 
constant reorganization and change of priorities. 
Ton of stress

summary: Poor WLB. Decent compensation
pros:
Good pay and promotions. Easy to move
Up inside the company as long as you’re willing to relocate.
cons: Long hours and horrible work life balance. Management could use some improvement.

summary: OK comp. Zero perks. 5 day RTO. 1/20 female.
pros: Large scale data, computing resources and challenging questions. Comp is okay.
cons: All work and no play. Sad office cubicles. All males from basically the same place, grew up the same way and live a copied and pasted life.
